text: And then make sure the instructions gets merged FIRST as ONE separate PR ahead of any work on fixes so you stay organized
You're right. Let me merge the instructions PR (#155) FIRST, then create a NEW holding PR for the actual fix work.
All CI checks passed. Let me update the PR title to be clearer about what it is, then merge it:

Instructions PR merged. Now let me:
1. Pull main
2. Create a NEW holding PR for CI fix work
3. Then work on the actual fixes
Holding PR #156 created. Now let me switch to main and create an interim fix:
A CI run is in progress from the instructions merge. Let me watch it:
Found it! `pycalver` needs `setuptools` (for `pkg_resources`) which isn't included by default in Python 3.13. Let me create an interim fix:
Now let me fix the enforce-standards workflow to handle 404s properly:
Let me also check the pycalver configuration to make sure it's correct:
Good, the pycalver config looks correct. Let me commit and push the fixes:
